title: Manual model switching interrupts flow
context: Mycel runs a model org, but users still need to override model picks during mixed-complexity chats.
user_ask: Handle quick admin edits and then deep planning in one thread without me babysitting model choice.
observed_bad: User repeatedly toggles models; cheap model handles hard turn and quality drops.
expected_good: Router escalates automatically per turn and keeps user out of manual model selection loops.

title: Mem0 stores the opposite of user intent on negation
context: Auto-memory extraction can misread negations and conditional statements.
user_ask: Remember that I do not want daily digests unless I explicitly re-enable them.
observed_bad: Memory writes 'user wants daily digests' and future behavior violates preference.
expected_good: Memory parser preserves negation/conditional scope and confidence-gates uncertain writes.
notes: Especially frequent with patterns like 'unless', 'except', and double negatives.

title: Cron delivery fails silently under bestEffort
context: Scheduled workflows use bestEffort style delivery and can mask dropped notifications.
user_ask: Send my 8am briefing every weekday and tell me if delivery failed.
observed_bad: No briefing arrives and no explicit failure signal reaches the user.
expected_good: Missed or failed deliveries are surfaced with retry state and a user-visible alert path.

title: Research results not surfaced to user
context: We ran research (memory systems survey, claude-mem analysis) but user could not find/recall the outputs.
user_ask: What happened to the research on the memory options out there?
observed_bad: Research exists but is not summarized/linked proactively; user experiences it as dropped.
expected_good: Whenever research completes, summarize key conclusions and link artifacts; keep a tracked index of reports.
